Class GameUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameUtils

  • public class GameUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Miscellaneous utilities related to running a game of Jeopardy.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.awt.Font GAME_FONT
      The default font for game text should be 16pt plain sans
      static java.awt.Font TITLE_FONT
      The default font for game titles should be 20pt bold sans

      • resize

        public static javax.swing.ImageIcon resize(javax.swing.ImageIcon srcImg,
                                           int w,
                                           int h)
        Change the size of an icon.
        Parameters:
        srcImg - the original icon
        w - the new width
        h - the new height
        Returns:
        the resized icon

      • findFile

        public static java.lang.String findFile(java.lang.String name)
        Find any file in the data folder, choosing from one of the possible locations of the folder.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file to find in the data folder. To find data/example.txt, pass example.txt.
        Returns:
        the full location of the file or null if it wasn't found

      • findImage

        public static java.lang.String findImage(java.lang.String name)
        Find an image in the data folder. Images should be located in data/images.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the image to locate. To find the image data/images/example.png pass example.png
        Returns:
        the full path to the image or null if it wasn't found
        See Also:
        findFile(String)

      • chooseFile

        public static java.lang.String chooseFile(java.lang.String[] prefixes,
                                          java.lang.String name)
        Find a file in one of several possible directories. This method checks if the file prefix/name exists, where name is the name of the file and prefix is a possible directory contianing the file. name stays the same, while the method runs through many possible prefixes.
        Parameters:
        prefixes - possible directories containing the file. If the individual strings in the array don't end in File.separator, it is added.
        name - the name of the file within the possible directories
        Returns:
        a location where the file exists or null if it wasn't found
